Title:     Custer Died for Your Sins:  An Indian Manifesto

Author:    Vine Deloria, Jr.

Pages:     278

Year:      1988

Publisher: University of Oklahoma Press

ISBN-10:   0806121297

ISBN-13:   978-0806121291

Language:  English

Book Description:

In his new preface to this quality paperback edition, the author observes, 'The Indian world has changed so substantially since the first publication of this book that some things contained in it seem new again.' Indeed, it seems that each generation of whites and Indians will have to read and re-read Vine Deloria's Manifesto for some time to come, before we absorb his special, ironic Indian point of view and what he tells us, with a great deal of humor, about U.S. race relations, federal bureaucracies, Christian churches, and social scientists. This book continues to be required reading for all Americans, whatever their special interest.

About the Author:

Vine Deloria, Jr., Professor of Political Science at the University of Arizona, is the author of a number of books and articles on events affecting the lives of American Indians. He serves as the Executive Director of the National Congress of American Indians and is an active spokesman and leader for the American Indian community throughout the nation.
